treatment.description: Forming dense mounds, the primocanes and their finally intricate divergent branches and trailing-tipped branchlets up to 2 m. long, remotely armed with horizontally divergent straight subulate prickles 3-5 mm. long and 2-3 mm. broad at base; primocane-leaves mostly 3-foliolate, membranaceous, tomentulose beneath; the ovate-acuminate leaflets with low serrate-dentate teeth; the terminal leaflet cordate at base and 8-12 cm. long by 5-7.5 cm. broad, the unguiculate-armed petiolule 2.5-3 cm. long; floricanes inextricably and divergently much branched, their prickles becoming unguiculate; floricane-leaflets narrowly elliptic-oval, acuminate, doubly serrate; short racemose corymb 2-8-flowered, overtopping the bracts; pedicels divergently ascending, 1-2.5 cm. long, retrorsely villous and prickly; calyx pilose; fruit 1.5-1.8 cm. in diameter.
